intro: Crotalaria anningensis, commonly known as the Anning's cowpea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and palmately compound leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive black spot, and it produces elongated pods containing kidney-shaped seeds. Crotalaria anningensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils.
